page.title: 03Tourism
page.content: Tourism is by far the most important aspect of this part of the Lake District.{The National Trust}owns the tarns and surrounding land and many thousands of people visit the area annually. It is renowned for its superb views of the Cumbrian Fells and Coniston Water. An ideal area for walking and photos, it has extensive car parks screened by trees, toilets and a disabled persons car park at a fine view point. Hawkshead is well known for its quaint, narrow streets and old buildings. It attracts many visitors to see the church, school, narrow alleys and yards. The road which originally went through the centre of the town has been closed except for pedestrians, and a bypass made. The camping and caravan sites, hotels and guest houses are used extensively during the summer.
